Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on visuals aired by ABP News, which were later found to be from the PUBG trailer.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the visuals used in the ABP News broadcast were actually from the PUBG trailer and not from the upcoming Indian game FAU-G.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the visuals shown on ABP News accurately represent the upcoming game FAU-G.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that ABP News mistakenly used visuals from the PUBG trailer instead of visuals from FAU-G.
Understate: The claim may understate the significance of using visuals from another game to represent FAU-G, as it could mislead viewers and create false expectations.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting inaccurate visuals and misleading information about FAU-G.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
